ARTICLE.TITLE: Xinhua world news summary at 1530 GMT, June 18
ARTICLE.TEXT:
You are here:

视频播放位置 下载安装Flash播放器

MOSCOW -- Four people, including a child, were killed by gunfire in an apartment here on Thursday, the Russian Investigative Committee said.

After receiving a call from neighbors, police officers and investigators arrived and found the bodies of two women, a man and a child with gunshot wounds in the apartment, the Moscow division of the committee said in a statement. (Russia-Moscow-Shooting)

- - - -

NUR-SULTAN -- Kazakhstan's first president Nursultan Nazarbayev has tested positive for COVID-19 and is undergoing self-isolation, the press service of the first president announced in a statement on Thursday.

"Unfortunately, the last coronavirus test of the first president showed a positive result. There is no reason to worry. Nursultan Nazarbayev continues to work remotely," the statement said. (Kazakhstan-Nazarbayev-COVID-19)

- - - -

MOGADISHU -- Somali National Army (SNA) backed by AMISOM forces on Wednesday killed seven al-Shabaab militants in an operation on the outskirts of Beledweyn town in the central region of Hiran, a military officer confirmed on Thursday.

Salah Ya'qub, commander of SNA's 27th Unit told reporters that the operation was a response for militants' mortar attacks on Luq Jelow village. (Somalia-Militants)

- - - -

ISLAMABAD -- Pakistan on Thursday reopened and operationalized its border crossing with Iran for seven days a week as part of its trade-facilitative measures during the COVID-19 pandemic, according to a notification issued by the Interior Ministry of Pakistan.

"Taftan border shall remain open seven days a week for trade only while ensuring proper SOPs (standard operating procedures) and guidelines," said the notification. (Pakistan-Iran-Border-Trade) Enditem
